q: In performance testing, which of the following categories does CPU, memory, and network utilization belongs to?
Which of the following types of testing is a superset of load and stress testing that can be used to test the workload limit both above and below the threshold of system failure?

In performance testing, which of the following is a popular HP load testing tool that is used to test an application under normal and peak conditions, by generating a workload with virtual users that simulate network traffic?

Which of the following types of testing has a challenge of ensuring the following after testing:

  • The system will return to its stable state.
  • The security of sensitive data will not be compromised.
Which of the following tools is an open-source Java application that is used for performance and load testing?

Which of these types of testing must be done to measure the following issues in performance testing:

  • Bandwidth issues
  • System capacity issues
  • Load-balancing issues 
  • Poor response time and throughput issues
In performance testing, which of the following types of testing is used to determine the response time of a web-server under normal, threshold, heavy, and breakpoint load of user requests?
Which of the following types of testing is used to test security issues, data corruption, slowness, and memory leaks in performance testing?

In performance testing, which of the following is a subset of load testing that mainly focuses on databases and works by populating a large amount of data within the system's database to monitor its behavior?
In performance testing, which of the following types of testing enforces an application's failure and monitors the recovery process?
Which of the following statements defines the primary goal of performance testing?

a.option: To determine whether an application passes or fails a test
To discover errors in an application
To establish the benchmark behavior of an application
To eliminate the performance bottlenecks from an application

q:
Which of these types of testing must be used to predict the following application failure: 

An application works normally when used for three hours or less but behaves abnormally with high chances of crashing when used continuously for more than seven hours.

What is the following action an example of:

Testing a printer by sending a large queue of documents for printing.

Which of the following statements differentiates between load testing and stress testing:

  1. Load testing is used to identify all possible performance bugs, while stress testing is used to identify issues related to speed, such as latency, response time, etc.
  2. Stress testing establishes the SLA (Service Level Agreements) of the application and identifies the upper limit of the system, while load testing sets the application's benchmark.
  3. Stress testing is a subset of performance testing that includes volume testing, while load testing has a very wide scope that includes spike testing.
  4. Load testing is used to test the system under normal workload conditions, while stress testing is used to test the system under extreme conditions.
Which of the following types of stress testing is used to test an application with extreme and unusual parameters in order to discover errors in unexpected scenarios?
Which type of testing must be used to determine an application's behavior when it is pushed beyond the threshold of failure?
Which of the following options is usually the first step in the performance testing process?
Which of the following attributes will be demonstrated by a software application that has hit the market without performance testing?
Which of the following quality attributes in performance testing determines the maximum capacity of users that a software application can handle?
Which of the following types of tests determines the performance of a system when it is subjected to a sudden increase in the workload beyond anticipated loads over a short period of time?

In the following graph, the red line represents the maximum user-capacity of a system and the other lines represent several performance tests that are run on the system.

Which of the following performance tests are represented by A and B?

Which of the following attributes are used to measure an application's speed in performance testing?

  1. Response time
  2. Throughput
  3. Resource usage
  4. Stability
  5. Latency of data
Which of the following type of testing involves testing an application with an anticipated load over an extended period of time?
In software testing, which of the following techniques is classified as a non-functional testing methodology?
Which of the following is NOT a valid type of stress testing?
